column4: My machine seems to take far too long to boot --- Grub --> Login = 64 seconds, Login --> Idle = 30 seconds
Athlon64 X2 3800+, 2GB PC3200 RAM, HD that clocks in at 76MB/s under HDParm
I don't know what to tell you.  Is this a vanilla install?  Did it used to go faster?
are you on dapper or edgy?
Edgy, updated to Feisty to see if that would help but no change in performance
you might want to contact jinacio on ubuntuforums.org looks like he has the same processor as you and knows ways of speeding up boot times
specifically using initNG instead of init
It's more the bit after boot that I'm more bothered about. 30 seconds from login to idle is excessive
do you have any startup scripts?

under System->Preferences->Sessions, Startup Programs tab, by default I had 4 scripts running, update-manager, gnome-power-manager, gnome-volume-manager --sm-disable, and /usr/lib/evolution/2.8/evolution-alarm-notify, you can probably disable the first and fourth
Yeah, I'd already turned those two off and nothing else special there, so still no idea :(
do you have compiz or beryl?
